intro: Justicia vincoides, commonly known as the flame flower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers are pollinated primarily by birds, especially hummingbirds, due to their bright colors and nectar-rich structure.
